stem: Given question: A cat wants to sleep, how will it lay? and answer: comfortable position, explain why in
no_more_50_words: To sleep, a cat will lay in a certain position that they find comfortable.
50_to_100_words: Cats will typically lay in a comfortable position when they want to sleep. This is because they are instinctually driven to seek out places that provide warmth, safety, and comfort in order to rest and conserve energy. Their flexible spine and lack of collar bone allows them to contort their body into small, tight spaces that provides comfort and security. Their fur also provides insulation that helps them stay warm. Cats also tend to knead and knead objects before they lay down to make a soft bed. Overall, their primary goal when sleeping is to ensure they are in a safe and comfortable position so they can rest and conserve energy.
